reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports every 90 days, and a midterm report by 15 December 2015, and a report with recommendations by 31 March 2016
summary:
The Security Council adopted Resolution 2226 (2015) on June 25, 2015, recalling previous resolutions on Côte d'Ivoire, Liberia, and Mali. 
The Council reaffirms its commitment to Côte d'Ivoire's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and unity. 
It notes the progress made in Côte d'Ivoire towards reconciliation, stability, and economic recovery, commending President Ouattara's leadership. 
The Council welcomes improved security, particularly in the west and along the Liberian border, while condemning January 2015 attacks. 
It calls on Ivorian stakeholders to work together to consolidate progress, address underlying tensions, and strengthen the rule of law. 
The Council welcomes steps towards fair, credible, and transparent presidential elections, including electoral reforms and the work of the Independent Electoral Commission. 
It commends the Special Representative of the Secretary-General's good offices mandate, supporting dialogue between the Government and opposition parties. 
The Council notes progress on disarmament, demobilization, and reintegration (DDR), with over 50,000 former combatants disarmed and demobilized. 
It emphasizes the need for continued efforts on DDR, including post-June 2015 reintegration activities. 
The Council commends efforts to restructure and professionalize Côte d'Ivoire's defense and security sector, prioritizing security sector reform. 
It emphasizes national reconciliation and social cohesion, welcoming inter-communal dialogue and encouraging the publication of the Commission dialogue, vérité et reconciliation's final report. 
The Council reiterates the vital role of women in conflict resolution and peacebuilding, emphasizing their equal participation and involvement in all efforts. 
The Council takes note of the report of the Secretary-General of 7 May 2015 and the letter of 18 June 2014 of the Government of Côte d'Ivoire requesting electoral assistance.
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

Reaffirms the importance of maintaining and promoting peace and security in Côte d’Ivoire and the role of women in re-establishing the fabric of society.

Welcomes efforts to improve human rights, but expresses concern about continued reports of human rights violations and abuses, including sexual violence against women and children.

Urges the Government of Côte d’Ivoire to combat impunity, ensure independent justice, and cooperate with the International Criminal Court.
